characters.name: Arkhe

moves.name: Elemental Master
moves.description: All elemental damage increased by 10%

moves.name: Airburst
moves.description: Arkhe shoots a gust of air dealing 30 air damage. Affected enemies have a 15% chance of being stunned next turn.

moves.name: Elemental Support
moves.description: Using the mastery of water and warth, provide 20 healing and 15 shield to an ally

moves.name: Monk's Rage
moves.description: Arkhe deals 100 fire damage

characters.lore: Arkhe is a monk from Valkun’s Reach, an isolated city on a distant world built beneath a stable skyborne rift. He is unaffiliated with any galactic organization but is respected across systems as a wandering elemental warrior. He is known primarily as an elemental monk — someone whose body and spirit have harmonized with the leylines near the Valkun Rift.

characters.name: Avarice

moves.name: Water Priestess
moves.description: Water and Ice damage aimed at Avarice is converted into health instead

moves.name: God Blow
moves.description: Avarice deals 30 water damage

moves.name: Blessing
moves.description: Avarice heals a character for 75 HP

moves.name: Resurrection
moves.description: Avarice can bring back a character that died this turn with 25% HP

characters.lore: Avarice is a water-attuned cleric hailing from Del'Terah, a lush oceanic planet marked by vast fjords, sunken temples, and semi-submerged cities. She is a devout follower of the water goddess Myriel and serves as a traveling divine channeler. She is both a healer and a wielder of destructive tidal magic. Though not formally tied to any galactic faction, she has participated in several interstellar operations under alliance banners when rift activity threatens sacred waters.

characters.name: Captain Dinso

moves.name: Vibranium Protection
moves.description: If an energy attack below 40 damage targets the Captain, there is a 50% chance for the damage to be reflected back

moves.name: Shield Bash
moves.description: The Captain slams his shield and does 20 physical damage.

moves.name: Ricochet
moves.description: The Captain skillfully throws his shield at an enemy and bounces it off them to hit a second enemy, dealing 15 physical damage each time.

moves.name: Constellian Command
moves.description: Allies receive a signature charge equal to 50% of their requirement. All debuffs on any party members are erased.

characters.lore: Dinso is a decorated officer of the Constellian Army, best known as the commanding captain of the 73rd Constellian Company (73rd CC). The 73rd CC is a versatile deployment unit stationed for rapid planetary response. Born in Silgar and trained at StarSprawler Academy, Dinso later transferred into the Constellian forces, rising through the ranks not just through tactical success but for his unwavering reputation as a protector and battlefield leader.

characters.name: Faru

moves.name: Rift Mutation
moves.description: All healing and damage bonus buffs given to Faru will be doubled

moves.name: Silver Sword Slash
moves.description: Faru attacks with his greatsword for 25 physical damage.

moves.name: Flaming Sword Strike
moves.description: Faru infuses his sword with fire and attacks for 45 fire damage. He has a 60% chance to inflict Burn, which deals 20 damage on the next turn.

moves.name: All Out
moves.description: Faru deals 60 physical damage. This damage is increased by 30 for every buff he currently has

characters.lore: Faru is a Rifthunter from Thalnys, a remote and technologically underdeveloped planet far from the galactic core. While Thalnys rarely sees large-scale rift events, it suffers from constant minor riftbreaks, which have over time led to extensive mutation of native wildlife and unstable terrain. Without a centralized military, most villages and small cities rely on freelance rifthunters for protection — genetically altered warriors trained from youth to combat rift-corrupted threats.

characters.name: Huron

moves.name: Silgar's Undying Protector
moves.description: Huron gains a 25% damage bonus for every 70 HP he regains. This effect can occur 3 times

moves.name: Scorch Ray
moves.description: Huron fires a blast dealing 50 energy damage

moves.name: Solar Cover
moves.description: Huron deals 18 energy damage to all enemies, and inflicts blinding,lowering their accuracy by 20% for the next turn

moves.name: Silgar's Might
moves.description: Huron creates a dragon of pure energy, punching through it to deal 160 energy damage

characters.lore: Huron is one of the most powerful mortals in Arkhalion’s history, a warrior of near-divine might and the living embodiment of Silgar’s martial spirit. He was discovered as an infant in the aftermath of a failed IWO purification ritual. His origin defies replication, and he has an affinity for divine magic and natural arcane resistance.Trained by Gosen, Silgar’s founder and last living divine general, Huron was raised in a world clawing its way back from oblivion. Though not a leader in the traditional sense, he became a symbol of resilience and the most celebrated independent combatant of the Delta, and perhaps soon the entire Constellian Alliance.

characters.name: Jack

moves.name: Crafty Crafty
moves.description: If an attack would have killed jack, it will instead reduce his hp to 1

moves.name: Blaster Rifle
moves.description: Jack shoots his rifle, dealing 20 energy damage.

moves.name: Targeted Strike
moves.description: Jack verbally abuses an enemy inflicting 'Mocked'. The next ally to attack the mocked enemy gains +20% damage

moves.name: Cindrillian Enhancements
moves.description: All allies gain a 30% damage bonus and 10 shield points

characters.lore:
Jack is a rogue artificer and saboteur hailing from Cindralith, known for his deep understanding of arcano-technological systems and a long history of weaponized mischief. Once a promising student at one of Cindralith’s top-tier engineering universities, Jack dropped out, or was expelled, depending on which version of the story he’s telling, and disappeared into the undercity.
He has since reemerged as a solo operative, deploying experimental gadgets and improvised tech to disable military-grade systems, disorient enemies, and undermine larger power structures. While not formally aligned with any state or institution, Jack often appears in Constellian Army databases , as a person of interest linked to unsanctioned weapons theft, sabotage, or data extraction.

characters.name: KAS

moves.name: Kinematic Assault Specialist
moves.description: If KAS wasn’t attacked during the previous turn, he gains a 10-point shield at the start of his turn.

moves.name: Cinder Stream
moves.description: KAS slashes the enemy in a flurry of strikes, dealing 40 physical damage.

moves.name: Dual Wield Precision
moves.description: KAS dashes to strike two enemies with 25 physical damage each. If only one enemy remains, both hits hit them.

moves.name: Sword Skill: Eclipse
moves.description: KAS unleashes a finishing combo dealing 100 energy damage and grants himself 10 shield.

characters.lore: KAS (Kinematic Assault System) is a hyper-agile mechanized combat unit developed by a private military tech group in Cindralith under the banner of Halion Dynamics. Designed to serve as a single-unit strike operative, KAS combines state-of-the-art technomantic circuitry with physical design principles derived from Rift-class creature countermeasures. The result is a machine optimized for high-speed, close-quarters combat — one that moves with frightening precision, reacts faster than the human eye, and follows its combat directives with unrelenting efficiency.

characters.name: Krakoa

moves.name: CA's Special Force
moves.description: Krakoa's physical and fire resistance increase by 10% for every 20% reduction in his health

moves.name: Riftbreaker Axe
moves.description: Krakoa attacks with his axe and deals 35 Ice damage.

moves.name: WarFrost
moves.description: Krakoa's axe unleashes a wall of ice, dealing 30 Ice damage. He inflicts Chill on an enemy for 2 turns, dealing 20 ice damage

moves.name: Warriors Rage
moves.description: Krakoa heals himself for 100 and becomes enraged for the next two turns. While Enraged, he only uses his normal attack and gains a 100% damage bonus multiplier

characters.lore: Krakoa is a Voidblade operative in the Constellian Navy’s elite special forces division, originally born and trained in Silgar. Though a graduate of StarSprawler Academy, Krakoa’s path through the academy was anything but conventional. His combat instincts, while exceptional, were often flagged as dangerously aggressive — nearly disqualifying him from advancement. He was eventually recruited into the Voidblade program after catching the attention of a Vice Helm during a live simulation.

characters.name: Mizca

moves.name: Multiplying Rage
moves.description: At the end of each round,The Mizca gains 15% damage bonus (capped at 50%) but takes 10 true damage.

moves.name: Saber Slice
moves.description: The Mizca slices with his rift weapon, dealing 40 energy damage.

moves.name: Hold Choke
moves.description: Mizca chokes an opponent, dealing 35 Air damage. If the opponent has less than half their max HP, they will gain Weakened, and do 30% reduced damage on their next attack.

moves.name: Power of the Corrupted
moves.description: Mizca rips at the very foundations of the battleground, and hurls large rocks at his enemies. Deals 55 earth damage at two enemies

characters.lore: Mizca are high-tier riftborn entities most commonly associated with Class B riftbreaks, though many A-class incidents have reported them as forward units. Standing taller than a giraffe at full extension but built with a broad, humanoid physique, Mizca embody both raw power and battlefield disruption. Despite their brutish profile, Mizca display alarming spatial awareness and can track fast-moving targets with unsettling accuracy.

characters.name: Nou

moves.name: Sky Goddess
moves.description: Nou is immune to air damage, and has a 40% chance to dodge attacks from characters

moves.name: Whirlwind
moves.description: Nou shoots a cyclone dealing 30 Air damage at two enemies

moves.name: Dust Storm
moves.description: Nou creates a dust storm. Deals 20 air damage and inflicts Covered, which reduces target's accuracy by 50% this turn

moves.name: World Wind
moves.description: Nou creates a powerful windstorm that deals 60 air damage to all enemies

characters.lore: Nou is a wind-aligned divine goddess and the central protector of Aetherion, one of the three major systems of Arkhalion’s Delta. Though once a lesser worshipped entity in the pre-Breakpoint era, Nou rose to prominence after the catastrophe, becoming the spiritual and magical guardian of survivors in the southern hemisphere. In the present day, she is the last god still active on Arkhalion and is considered the founder and enduring protector of Aetherion.

characters.name: Olthar

moves.name: Arbiter of Silgar
moves.description: Party members under 100 HP gain a 50% damage buff (checked at start of each round)

moves.name: Ocular Blaster
moves.description: Olthar shoots an enery blast from his eyes, dealing 35 energy damage.

moves.name: Concussive Wave
moves.description: Olthar's Hands shoot a wave of concussive force, dealing 20 air damage per enemy.

moves.name: Word of Judgement
moves.description: Olthar deals 60 energy damage and 15 energy damage to an enemy for the next two turns.

characters.lore:
Olthar is the Lawbearer of Silgar and the highest judicial authority in the city-state. A sentient construct forged by the Intergalactic Wizarding Organization (IWO) during the darkest days of Silgar’s history, Olthar represents the fusion of divine essence, technomantic engineering, and legal idealism. Though not a divine being in strength, he possesses a soul, one of the first successful artificial souls ever manifested, and a mind built for clarity, logic, and incorruptibility.
He is widely credited with ending Silgar’s most shameful period (The Shrouded Silgar era) and establishing the modern legal and ethical framework under which the city now operates.

characters.name: Rover

moves.name: Targeting System
moves.description: Increases allies accuracy by 20%

moves.name: Zapper
moves.description: Deals 10 lightning damage

moves.name: Confusion Tactics
moves.description: Rover's anti-radar lowers an enemy's accuracy by 15%, deals 15 physical damage

moves.name: System Hack
moves.description: Rover finds the opponents weak spots. All enemies lightning and energy resistance is reduced by 30%

characters.lore:
Rover is a modified combat-support droid serving aboard Constellian Navy single-pilot interceptor vessels as a tactical adjunct and systems specialist. Originally built from a common astromech-class model available to civilians in Constellian systems, Rover has undergone extensive post-manufacture modification to meet the Navy’s high-performance standards — particularly those of the elite Riftstrike carrier fleet. 
 Unlike most non-sentient droids, Rover possesses a stable AI core with adaptive learning protocols, giving him a distinct personality and battlefield intuition. While he is not unique in chassis design, the combination of his field modifications and accumulated experience make him one of the most reliable droids in the Navy’s current roster.

characters.name: Raish

moves.name: Sacrifice
moves.description: When an ally dies, Raish's damage is increased by 50%

moves.name: Claw
moves.description: Raish strikes dealing 20 poison damage

moves.name: Venomous Strike
moves.description: Raish bites with its corrupted mouth, dealing 30 poison damage

moves.name: Martyr
moves.description: Raish deals poison damage equal to 150% of the damage it has received

characters.lore: Raish are corrupted quadrupedal riftbeasts commonly encountered in Class C or D riftbreaks across Arkhalion and nearby systems. They are mutated derivatives of a natural predator species known as the Rais, once native to Arkhalion’s southern forests and highlands. While Rais were roughly the size and strength of a large mastiff, rift corruption amplifies their aggression, durability, and instinctive cunning, making the Raish a dangerous threat in groups.

characters.name: Rei

moves.name: Electric Empress
moves.description: The shogun is immune to lightning damage. She is also immune to Energy attacks dealing 30 damage or less

moves.name: Katana Strike
moves.description: The Shogun attacks with her lightning katana, dealing 40 lightning damage

moves.name: Burst Charge
moves.description: Rei deals 35 Lightning damage to an opponent and inflicts Electroshock for 2 turns. Enemies that are electroshocked have their electric and water resistance decreased by 20%, and will take 10 damage per turn

moves.name: Musou no Hitotachi
moves.description: The Shogun slices the fabric of reality with her blade, dealing 140 lightning damage at an enemy and a 40% chance to inflict Stun. Stunned enemies cannot act on their turn, but status effects will take place

characters.lore: Rei is a mid-ranking operative within the Applied Arcana Division of the Intergalactic Wizarding Organization (IWO), holding the formal clearance rank of Tier IV Arc Warden. She is based on Arkhalion, where she oversees the testing and deployment of experimental magical technologies near active or unstable rift zones. Though not originally trained as a combatant, Rei’s years in the field have sharpened her reflexes and resilience to the point where even elite Silgarian soldiers acknowledge her capability in high-risk zones.

characters.name: Sedra

moves.name: Tamaranean Durability
moves.description: Sedra has a 50% chance to ignore physical attacks under 30 damage.

moves.name: Heat Vision
moves.description: Sedra shoots lasers out her eyes and deals 40 Energy Damage.

moves.name: Nova Lash
moves.description: Sedra dashes in and slashes a target with solar fire, dealing 40 energy damage and applying Solar Wind (20 energy dmg over 2 turns)

moves.name: Starburst Explosion
moves.description: Sedra launches a giant explosion, dealing 50 AoE energy damage.

characters.lore: Sedra is a magically gifted young woman born in Aetherion, the daughter of two of the city’s most influential figures. Her father holds the Elevation Seat on the Council of Ascendance, while her mother serves as the current Windsage of the Whispering Academy. From an early age, Sedra demonstrated signs of inborn divine energy, believed by scholars to be a faint resonance of Nou’s blessing, or perhaps a unique convergence of Aetherion’s ley currents and her bloodline. She is a rising defender of Aetherion and often serves as a first response combatant for major rift activity in the region.

characters.name: TRex

moves.name: Apex Predator
moves.description: When T-Rex is the only surviving member of his team, gain 50% damage and full signature charge

moves.name: CHOMP
moves.description: Trex bites dealing 40 physical damage

moves.name: ROAR
moves.description: The Rex attempts to inflict terrify on a target.Terrified lasts 2 turns and decreases accuracy by 40% and damage by 50%. Base 20% chance. For every 10% below the maxHP of the target, chance to terrify the target increases 20%.

moves.name: Tyrant Lizard King
moves.description: Trex bites dealing 50 physical damage and inflict Poisoned. When Poisoned, The target takes 20 poison damage for the next 2 turns

characters.lore:
A towering, rift-altered predator, the Corrupted T-Rex is an apex-class threat born from the dimensional corruption of a prehistoric Earth-like species. This riftbeast falls under the category of a rift-mutated natural organism, elevated far beyond its original capabilities by exposure to high-intensity riftfields. 
 Reports place its height at nearly 20 meters with enhanced bone density, triple-reinforced musculature, and rift-reactive scales that shed kinetic energy over time. Despite its brutish form, it is one of the most persistent planetary-scale threats recorded outside of Apex-Class 2 entities.

characters.name: Ulmika

moves.name: Aretuza's Patronage
moves.description: Ulmika removes a debuff on an ally once per round on her turn

moves.name: Witch's Chill
moves.description: Ulmika deals 15 ice dmg

moves.name: Witch's Blessing
moves.description: Yen grants a shield of 50 points to 2 allies or herself

moves.name: Flaming Devastation
moves.description: Yen consumes 60% of her current HP and deals 70 fire damage and inflict Burn for an additional 20 fire damage for 2 turns

characters.lore:
Ulmika is a Tier II Field Agent assigned to the Reconnaissance Subfield of the IWO Combat Division. Born in Arkhalion’s lower plains region and raised in a modest settlement rebuilt after the Breakpoint, Ulmika was recruited early into the IWO following a childhood encounter with a minor riftbreak — an event that left her with a distinctive rift-colored eye and a subtle, persistent sensitivity to rift phenomena.
 She now operates as part of forward-deployed detachments, often assigned to accompany Constellian military units during Class 3–4 riftbreaks. Her role blends recon, magical analysis, and long-range elemental support.

characters.name: VyGar

moves.name: Defensive Rock
moves.description: All resistances for all allies increase by 10%

moves.name: Spear Strike
moves.description: VyGar attacks dealing 30 physical damage

moves.name: Meteor Strike
moves.description: VyGar fires a rock at all opponents. Each hit does 15 earth damage.

moves.name: Mighty Shield
moves.description: VyGar casts a shield on a party member. This shield has 350 shield points.

characters.lore: VyGar is a Zavrosian weapons appraiser contracted frequently by the Constellian Armed Forces and various independent trusts. He specializes in collecting weapons that have historical, political, or tactical significance. Born in the forge-cluster of Durnskarn, he rejected his clan’s traditional role as smiths and became an interpreter of weapon history instead. His knowledge of both conventional and technomantic arms has made him a valued figure in intelligence and logistics circles. Though officially unaffiliated with any state, VyGar operates on the edge of legality, with suspected ties to unsanctioned trade networks across the Alliance.
